intro: Pleurothallis robledorum, commonly known as the Robledó's spider orchid, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Central America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees and rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant features intricate, delicate flowers with a unique coloration pattern, often resembling spider-like structures, hence its common name. Its roots are adapted to absorb moisture and nutrients from the air and surrounding substrate. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
